title: Sales Engineer
description: Veolia Water Technologies are global leaders in water and wastewater treatment. Offering water treatment equipment and solutions, water purification and sustainable recovery. We provide a complete range of service solutions for water treatment: from drinking water treatment to transforming wastewater into a resource and a sustainable water supply. Our approach is to think globally but act locally. Our global business units develop and manage the technologies required to design and optimize water treatment systems and plants. We then rely on our local experts to deliver these technologies and ensure a high-quality proximity service. Our organization allows us to react quickly and ensure we deliver projects and services that are adapted to local needs, while benefiting from global technologies and capitalizing on the return of experience of similar installations around the world.

responsibilities: Common tasks include:, , â¢    Building and maintaining strong relationships with clients: The service manager is responsible for establishing trust and confidence with clients and ensuring that they feel valued and supported., â¢    Understanding client needs and preferences: The service manager must be attuned to the needs and preferences of their clients, and work to tailor services, and solutions to meet those needs, while ringfencing the scope of service or identifying the incremental demands, â¢    Communicating with clients: The service manager must be an effective communicator, able to articulate complex information in a clear and concise manner. They must also be able to listen effectively to understand the needs and concerns of clients. They must present a unified view of SimCorp and decrease the exposure of customer to multiple underlying delivery stacks, â¢    Solving problems and resolving conflicts: When specific issues arise, the service manager must be able to identify the root cause, provide solutions, and mediate conflicts between clients and other stakeholders. They must resolve any decision paralysis by applying the right governance., â¢    Providing support and advice: They must be knowledgeable about the products, services, and solutions that SimCorp offers and be able to provide advice and support to clients as needed., â¢    Gathering and analyzing data: The service manager must be able to gather data, analyze it, and use it to identify trends and opportunities to improve service levels and quality for clients., â¢    Staying current with industry trends: The service manager must stay informed about industry trends, changes, and innovations, and be able to incorporate this knowledge into their work with clients., The Service Manager will be responsible for managing the various needs of onboarding, acceptance, run, and renew phases of the customer service lifecycle. They will play a critical role in driving service adoption, managing escalations, aligning service roadmaps, and driving customer-centric service delivery., , Key Responsibilities / Accountabilities:, , â¢    Support onboarding projects by providing standard service offerings and scopes overviews to the customers, â¢    Build peer relationships with service consumers to ensure a smooth onboarding process and drive service adoption and ensure onboarding expectations are aligned, â¢    Manage escalations and communicate customer experience goals to ensure a positive experience during service life cycle, â¢    Collaborate with project managers and customer success managers on bundled deals and drive shared common objectives, â¢    During projects and daily business, manage scope creep/changes resulting in fee implications and ensure service scope governance is in place, â¢    Continuously assess the customer experience to ensure customer satisfaction, â¢    Facilitate the alignment of service solutions with the service roadmap and improvement metrics, â¢    Manage major incident communications and lead the Root Cause Analysis (RCA) retrospection process in collaboration with the service and operational owners., â¢    Form workstreams with service delivery managers and customer success managers to enhance the end-to-end customer experience, â¢    Develop the customer community and manage NPS and CSAT governance processes as well as service improvement KPIs to ensure customer voice is heard, â¢    Contribute to the service strategy by incorporating customer feedback and industry standards into service improvements, â¢    Ensure strategic governance processes are in place to drive continued growth and customer satisfaction, â¢    Maintain and update SLAs, policies and other critical service documentation in collaboration with the delivery team.
